fabapi package¶

Module contents¶

A Python wrapper for the Find-A-Bug REST API.

fabapi.get_fields(resource: str) → List[str][source]¶

Get all fields available within the specified resource table.

Parameters:

resource – The name of the resource. One of ‘metadata’, ‘annotations’, or ‘sequences.’

Returns:

A list of field names.

fabapi.get_gene_ids_with_genome_id(genome_id: str, page: int = 0) → DataFrame[source]¶

Gets all the genes IDs associated with a particular genome.

Parameters:

  • genome_id – The GTDB accession for a particular genome.

  • page – The page of results to return.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the query results.

fabapi.get_gene_ids_with_ko(ko: str, page: int = 0) → DataFrame[source]¶

Gets all results from the database for a particular KO group.

Parameters:

  • ko – The KO group of the genes to be retrieved.

  • page – The page of results to return.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the query results.

fabapi.get_genome_id_with_gene_id(gene_id: str, verbose: bool = False) → DataFrame[source]¶
fabapi.get_gtdb_taxonomy_with_genome_id(genome_id: str) → DataFrame[source]¶
fabapi.get_ko_with_gene_id(gene_id: str, page: int = 0, verbose: bool = False) → DataFrame[source]¶

Gets all the KO groups associated with a particular genome.

Parameters:

  • gene_id – The GTDB accession for a particular gene.

  • page – The page of results to return.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the query results.

fabapi.get_ko_with_genome_id(genome_id: str, page: int = 0, verbose: bool = False) → DataFrame[source]¶

Gets all the KO groups associated with a particular genome.

Parameters:

  • genome_id – The GTDB accession for a particular genome.

  • page – The page of results to return.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the query results.

fabapi.get_sequence_with_gene_id(gene_id: str) → DataFrame[source]¶

Gets the amino acid sequence for a particular gene.

Parameters:

gene_id – The GTDB accession for the gene for which the sequence will be retrieved.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the amino acid sequence.

fabapi.get_url(filters: Dict[str, List[str]], resource: str, page: int = 0, verbose: bool = False) → str[source]¶

Converts a set of search options to an API URL to be sent to the microbes.caltech.gps.edu server.

Parameters:

  • cols – The names of the columns in the database to access.

  • filters – The filters to apply to each column, given as a tuple of (operator, value), or a single value (equality operator implied).

  • resource – The resource table to access (one of ‘sequences’, ‘metadata’, or ‘annotations’)

  • page – The page of results to retrieve.

Returns:

The URL for accessing the Find-A-Bug web application.

fabapi.info(resource: str) → NoReturn[source]¶

Returns the column descriptions for the specified resource.

fabapi.parse_response(response: Response) → DataFrame[source]¶

Takes a requests Response object, extracts the text, and converts it to a pandas DataFrame. An exception is raised if appropriate.

Parameters:

response – The response object obtained using requests.get.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the data in the response.
